definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To split or sever something with, or as if with, a sharp instrument.
examples: The wings cleaved the foggy air.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , mineralogy ) To break a single crystal (such as a gemstone or semiconductor wafer ) along one of its more symmetrical crystallographic planes (often by impact ), forming facets on the resulting pieces.
( transitive ) To make or accomplish by or as if by cutting.
examples: The truck cleaved a path through the ice.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) ( chemistry ) To split (a complex molecule) into simpler molecules.
( intransitive , mineralogy ) Of a crystal, to split along a natural plane of division.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To split or sever something with, or as if with, a sharp instrument.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , mineralogy ) To break a single crystal (such as a gemstone or semiconductor wafer ) along one of its more symmetrical crystallographic planes (often by impact ), forming facets on the resulting pieces.
( transitive ) To make or accomplish by or as if by cutting.
( transitive ) ( chemistry ) To split (a complex molecule) into simpler molecules.
( intransitive , mineralogy ) Of a crystal, to split along a natural plane of division.

definitions.definition: Followed by to or unto : to adhere , cling , or stick fast to something.

main_definition: ( intransitive , rare ) Followed by to or unto : to adhere , cling , or stick fast to something.
